item.title: Using Cron
item.description: Cron is a very common job scheduler for linux. It allows users to run the same command or shell script periodically. Typically it is used to automate tasks, for example, every Monday run my script to plot last week’s data. There are many guides to using cron and crontab  (the command for loading the cron job table).
